casebody.data:
Karl R. SMITH, James Reed, Joseph Wachtre and Ed Owens, Appellants, v. PITTSBURGH GAGE AND SUPPLY COMPANY, a Pennsylvania Corporation, and Steamfitters Local Union No. 449 of the United Association of Journeymen and Apprentices of the Plumbing and Pipe Fitting Industry of the United States and Canada, an Unincorporated Association. No. 15773. United States Court of Appeals Third Circuit. Argued May 17, 1966. Decided June 3, 1966. Donald E. Rohall, Pittsburgh, Pa., for appellants. John G. Wayman, Pittsburgh, Pa. (Leonard L. Scheinholtz and Reed, Smith, Shaw & McClay, Pittsburgh, Pa., on the brief), for appellees.

Before STALEY, Chief Judge, and McLAUGHLIN and SMITH, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

This suit was brought by appellants against their employer and union under 29 U.S.C. § 301 et seq. We have fully reviewed the record and affirm the judgment of the district court on the excellent opinion of Judge Rosenberg, 245 F.Supp. 864 (W.D.Pa., 1965).

The judgment of the district court will be affirmed.
